Name: The Atlanta JavaScript Meetup Group
Description: Meet other local JavaScripters to share knowledge, to review the state of the art, or to dream up new applications.

Name: Freeside Atlanta
Description: Freeside is a Makerspace for hackers, designers, artists, students, and hobbyists in Atlanta, Georgia. We host lots of classes and projects to help people network and make their ideas a reality.

Name: PyAtl: Atlanta Python Programmers
Description: PyAtl meets every month in Atlanta for presentations and discussion about Python, the powerful and easy-to-use programming language. Every meeting tries to include something for beginners, and also to tackle advanced topics for seasoned developers. We are all learning, so don't be shy about attending, no matter your experience level! Come discover the feeling of community that emerges when people step forward from behind their blogs and keyboards to talk about their favorite programming language.

Name: Atlanta Startup Founder 101
Description: At Startup Founder 101, aspiring and early-stage startup founders meet once a month to hear candid talks by successful local entrepreneurs. Learn the best practices, strategies, and mistakes to avoid from those who have been there, done that. Then, if you’d like, you can share your ideas and plans in a relaxed setting to get personal and professional feedback.

Name: Atlanta Web Design Group
Description: We aim to provide a place for Web professionals to meet new people, exchange ideas, learn new things, and have a little fun. We have several events each month: one for learning, and happy hours all over the metro area for socializing.

Name: Data Science & Business Intelligence Society of Atlanta
Description: The Data Science and Business Intelligence Society of Atlanta is a vendor-neutral organization created for the purpose of sharing knowledge and experiences relative to data science and business intelligence, exploratory and predictive analytics.

Name: Atlanta Big Data User Group
Description: The Atlanta Big Data Meetup group is an Atlanta based community of technology professionals dedicated to promoting the solutions, best practices, and innovative ideas needed for enterprise organizations to get the maximum value from the data their organizations are collecting every day. With over 2.5 quintillion bytes of data are created every day, we are at the epicenter of a "data" revolution. Through an exchange of BIG ideas, education, and fresh thinking from data professional, technologists, and enthusiasts, Atlanta Big Data aims to focus on providing interesting insights into issues related to data visualization, data in motion, data at rest, batch processing, and cover leading edge architectures, and solutions related to the Big Data to include security, privacy, analytics, and support from development to operations. The intent of Atlanta Big Data isn’t solely technical, the Group strives to discuss, discover, and communicate how Big Data solutions can be used to advance and support national security, energy, transportation, media, logistics, financial services, law enforcement, healthcare, and education and many other areas that serve our community’s interests.

Name: North Atlanta JavaScript and Web Dev
Description: Welcome to the North Atlanta JavaScript User Group

Name: SEO & Wordpress
Description: SEO & Wordpress meetup (http://www.meetup.com/atlanta-wordpress-seo) group is designed to help small business owners to be found online.

Name: The Iron Yard - Atlanta
Description: The Iron Yard exists to create exceptional growth and mentorship for people and their ideas through tech-focused education. We’re passionate about the communities we exist in and strive to be good citizens of the tech industry. Our doors are open to everyone who wants to learn about technology, from kids to people who want to change careers. Come to one of our events to see what all of the excitement is about.

Name: Atlanta Tech & Entertainment - Workshops & Competitions
Description: High quality, free technology and entertainment workshops and competitions by AT&T

Name: Atlanta Web Technology Group
Description: We are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that is dedicated to the education and discussion of web and mobile technologies. We are the oldest continuous running technology user group in Atlanta, and membership is completely FREE.

Name: Data Science ATL
Description: A gathering of current and aspiring Data Science practitioners. We focus on practical applications of exploratory data analysis, statistics, machine learning and data visualization to solve interesting problems in any field.

Name: The Atlanta iOS Developers
Description: This group is dedicated to people developing native applications for the Apple iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch or any iOS device (including Mac apps).

Name: Atlanta WordPress Users Group
Description: This group is the oldest and largest Atlanta WordPress Meetup.

Name: Atlanta Mobile Developers Group
Description: The Atlanta Mobile Developers Group is a group of individuals that are involved with or interested in the area mobile development & technology.

Name: The Online ColdFusion Meetup
Description: The Online ColdFusion Meetup, hosted since early 2007 by Charlie Arehart, has held 250 presentations by several dozen speakers on CF-related topics (and non-CF topics that may be of interest to CFers). CF users from anywhere are free to attend. Become a member here (free, joining 2,700+ others) to get notified of new meetings, optionally participate in ratings and discussions, and more.

Name: Atlanta Scrum Users Group
Description: Meet local professionals interested in Agile/Scrum methods of software development.

Name: Women Who Code Atlanta
Description: Follow us! @WWCAtl (http://twitter.com/wwcatl) #wwcode FB: Women Who Code (http://fb.com/womenwhocode)

Name: Learn to Code | Thinkful Atlanta
Description: Want to learn to code but don’t know where to start? This meetup was created to help people in Atlanta learn to code and gain new skills in web development and data science. Join us weekdays at 6:30pm for free workshops, info sessions, tech talks, and happy hours focused on building new skills and growing your career. Our events are well-suited for both beginners learning to code as well as intermediate developers or data scientists looking to level-up. We're proud to be sponsored by Thinkful Atlanta (https://www.thinkful.com/bootcamp/atlanta/?aff=meetup), the #1 rated coding bootcamp on CourseReport, who contributes a team of experienced mentors and career coaches to help out at events.

Name: Tech Talent South - Atlanta
Description: Welcome to Tech Talent South Atlanta! Here you can find information about TTS hosted events, alumni updates, and information on how Tech Talent South is empowering folks to do BIG things!

Name: Art in Tech Atlanta
Description: Simply, our meetup aims to fuse the world of art and the world of tech.

Name: IxDA Atlanta
Description: IxDA Atlanta is the local chapter of the Interaction Design Association. Since 2009, we've put on design slams, socials, film screenings, UX show & tells, and hosted local and national speakers from the professional and academic communities. If you're into user experience, design, technology, strategy, or just want to learn more, we invite you to join the conversation.

Name: Code for Atlanta
Description: We invite technologists of all stripes -- coders, designers, data scientists, product managers, and more -- to join our all-volunteer efforts to make Atlanta a better place. Anyone can lead a civic-minded, social good project. We welcome partnerships with local non-profits and government agencies on projects that serve the public and engage with all of metro Atlanta's communities.

Name: Atlanta Ruby Meetup Group
Description: ATLRUG is a non-profit organization of individuals interested in developing, promoting, fostering, strengthening, and improving the Ruby programming language and Ruby community.

Name: Learn Code in Atlanta (Study Groups)
Description: Learn to love code with learn.co! Whether you're brand new and have no programming experience or are already pursuing a career change to software development, get some in-person support from others by attending these study groups. Remember to bring your laptop and a charger!

Name: Girl Develop It Atlanta
Description: Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it.

Name: Nerd Fun - Atlanta
Description: Let's get together and check out museums, cinema, music, lectures, festivals and all things interesting. It's a great way to meet new people and socialize with your fellow brainiacs.

Name: Cloud Computing Atlanta
Description: A gathering place and forum for discussion of all things related to Cloud Computing. Originally, the "AWSome Atlanta" group (with a focus on Amazon Web Services), this group has become the vendor-neutral (but vendor-friendly) braintrust of the Atlanta Cloud Computing community, rife with architects, developers, engineers, consultants, salesfolks and newbies alike! Come join us, and take part in the (r)evolution that is Cloud Computing!

Name: DevOpsATL
Description: Want to find out the last information about this group or chat about DevOPS? Many of us hangout in #DevOPS (https://tech404.slack.com/messages/devops) on Tech404 (http://tech404.io/).

Name: Atlanta Nodejs Developers
Description: The focus of this group will be to learn node js through a practical approach. We will have speakers followed by "open spaces" discussions.

Name: The Atlanta Blockchain
Description: The Atlanta Blockchain (TAB). This group focuses on educating the community about decentralized crypto technologies. Many new and exciting things are happening in this space, things are changing quickly, don't be left behind. The future will be encrypted and decentralized and this is the time to learn what the heck is going on. We will focus on many things including: Bitcoin, Blockchain, Ethereum, decentralized storage, alt-coins, mining, programming, blockchain as a database, general education 101's, and more. Please come join us to be part of this technology revolution!

Name: Atlanta Java Users Group
Description: The Atlanta Java Users Group (AJUG) is organized by Java Developers for Java Developers in order to:

Name: Decatur Makers
Description: Decatur Makers is a welcoming, family-friendly community of inquisitive, motivated people who work together in a safe environment to discover, understand, design and create interesting things.

Name: Atlanta Hadoop Users Group
Description: We're a group of Hadoop & Cloud Computing technologists / enthusiasts / curious people who discuss emerging technologies, Hadoop & related software development (HBase, Hypertable, PIG, etc).

Name: PyData Atlanta
Description: PyData-Atlanta is interested in telling insightful stories about data and exploring the methods behind those stories. We advocate for open data ecosystems and workflows that center on open source tools, especially (but not exclusively) based in Python. We are focused on the vertical integration of tools and skills that transform raw data into insights, and we aim to provide a seminar-like learning environment. We host short interactive presentations, audience-contributed lightning talks (please sign up here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeSNEeUWP77Jr8fm7NhOQxu2DPJG1r3kPGmGHX0kDyNJsLKig/viewform)), panel discussions, and informal networking opportunities. Our events can benefit both experienced and beginner data scientists alike.

Name: Atlanta Bloggers
Description: Meet other bloggers to talk about blogging, internet marketing, social media, tips and techniques, practices, SEO, writing and general support. All blog topics are welcome.

Name: DigitalCrafts | Learn to Code in Atlanta
Description: Learning to code? DigitalCrafts (http://digitalcrafts.com/) is the top-rated coding bootcamp in Atlanta and Houston. Our Full Stack curriculum is proven and our graduates have been hired at great companies like Home Depot, New York Times, Car & Driver, LiveAction, Soltech, Market America, Narwhal Digital, RiskAlyze, Liaison Technologies, and more. Our programs are designed to transform beginners into full-stack software engineers with cutting edge skill sets, polished portfolios, interview training, and career support. We also offer rotating, evening electives for current students and alumni as an additional perk of joining our network.

Name: ATLANTA MINORITIES IN TECHNOLOGY
Description: http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/7/c/f/600_434954287.jpeg

Name: AtlantaPHP Meetup Group
Description: AtlantaPHP is the Southeast's premier PHP community. We are dedicated to building up the PHP community, providing networking opportunities, and developing the skills of our members.

Name: Atlanta .Net User Group
Description: The Atlanta .NET User Group is an independent user group formed by developers for developers. The group is the result of combining the Atlanta ASP.NET and Atlanta VB User Groups.

Name: ATL Angular
Description: Who we're geared towards:

Name: The Business Intelligence SIG
Description: The Business Intelligence SIG is a Special Interest Group within Executive Leadership Institute. The Executive Leadership Institute is a premier membership organization and business forum. The goal of the Institute to connect members, providing opportunities for strategic relationship development, access to intellectual exchange and world class speakers, and enhanced exposure to the broader business community.

Name: Big Data Developers in Atlanta
Description: For Developers interested in learning about big data applications, technology and industry. Get jump started with Hadoop scripting, visualizations, and text analytics to address the full spectrum of Big Data business challenges.

Name: Google Developer Group Atlanta
Description: Google Developer Group (GDG) Atlanta is the local Atlanta chapter of the larger, global network of Google Developer Groups.

Name: Atlanta Android Developers
Description: The place to be for Google Android developers!

Name: Association of Black Engineers, Scientists and Technologists
Description: The ABEST Mission: To promote business and employment opportunities for black engineering, science and technology professionals so they may realize their full potentials, make enhanced contributions to their respective fields, and make enhanced contributions to our communities. http://www.blackbiztech.com - Our Social Network

Name: Big Data Processing & Analytics - HPCC Systems (LexisNexis)
Description: A professional meetup for technology and business executives and managers to discuss solving the challenges of big data processing, delivery and analytics.

Name: Hacks/Hackers Atlanta
Description: The worlds of hackers and journalists are coming together as reporting goes digital and Internet companies become media empires.

Name: Atlanta Deep Learning Meetup
Description: Deep learning is everywhere now. Every time you do a Google search, you are using a trained deep learning model. Google CEO Sundar Pichai recently asserted that if the last decade was about ‘mobile-first’, then the next decade will be about ‘AI-first’. Within the larger artificial intelligence and machine learning domains, ‘deep learning’ is where many of the most significant innovations are occurring - self-driving cars, self-organizing drone swarms, computer vision, conversational interfaces, gene editing, emotion recognition, etc.,

Name: ProductTank Atlanta
Description: ProductTank provides an opportunity for Product Managers in Atlanta to exchange ideas and experiences about Product Design, Development and Management, Business Modelling, Metrics, User Experience and all the other things that get us excited.

Name: Docker Atlanta
Description: Learn, Collaborate & Dockerize! Meet other developers and ops engineers in your community that are using and learning about Docker. Docker is an open platform that helps you build, ship and run applications anytime and anywhere. Developers use Docker to modify code and to streamline application development, while operations gain support to quickly and flexibly respond to their changing needs. Docker ensures agility, portability and control for all your distributed apps.

Name: amUX
Description: Morning Meetings for the UX-Curious

Name: Atlanta Full Stack
Description: We at Manheim have some of the best Atlanta software engineers, SDETs and BAs. To give back to the community we will facilitate discussions about some of the most powerful technologies we use, from languages, frameworks, pipelining and continuous delivery to name a few.

Name: A Brighter Web
Description: A monthly Meetup, typically held three times each month on Thursdays at lunchtime, discussing WordPress from the developer, user and business owner perspectives. We'll spend 20-30 minutes presenting the latest topic and giving you hands-on ideas to incorporate, and the rest of the time will be spent working with each other on the daily topic or any other WordPress or social media issue that you might have.

Name: Atlanta Web Performance Group
Description: ATL Web Performance Meetup is the largest monthly gathering of performance minded developers in Atlanta, hosted at Atlanta Tech Village (http://atlantatechvillage.com/).

Name: AWS Atlanta
Description: This group will focus on the use of AWS. Presentations and discussions will cover topics such as:

Name: Atlanta Artificial Intelligence & Deep Learning
Description: Welcome to the group. We’re excited to bring you the latest happenings in AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Science and Big Data.

Name: ALE-Atlanta Linux Enthusiasts
Description: The Atlanta Linux Enthusiasts (formerly GA 400 Linux Group) was been started to allow the casual to advanced Linux users to get together and share ideas, knowledge, and face-time with other Linux users. We're focused on helping beginning and returning Linux users learn the basics by establishing a solid foundation. We'll discuss distributions, file systems and storage, installation, databases, networking, and more!

Name: Atlanta User Experience Group
Description: The Atlanta User Experience Group (AUX) brings together members of the UX community. From information architects to designers to coders, this group provides a place for UX professionals to meet new people, exchange ideas, learn new things, and have a good experience (pun intended).

Name: ATL Tech Tastings Meetup
Description: ATL Tech Tastings focus on intimate networking events for people in and around software development. We focus on events that revolve around tastings and meeting new people in a relaxed environment. If you’re tired of mechanically handing out business cards after sitting through the same rehashed presentation, skip the small talk and enjoy some great drinks with us.

Name: React ATL
Description: React ATL is a monthly developer meetup to discuss trends and tools coming out of the ReactJS ecosystem. Subjects can include Flux patterns, Webpack, Jest, Flow, etc. We will also discuss how React is shaping the rest of the javascript world and how we use other tools along side React. Each meeting will start with food, drinks, and socializing before moving into a main talk. Afterwards the floor will be open for Q and A and lightening talks from participants.

Name: Azure in the ATL
Description: Cloud computing is already a multi-billion dollar business for Microsoft, and yet Azure is just now hitting its stride. Perhaps you're a long-time MS stack developer wondering "where do I go from here?" Maybe you're a seasoned dev manager or director curious how cloud in general and Azure in particular might fit into your next project. If you're looking for the future of Microsoft on the server and in the enterprise... you've found it! This group caters to all things Microsoft Azure and cloud computing. We'll explore a range of topics in three key areas (in likely order of decreasing frequency):

Name: Gwinnett Georgia Microsoft Users Group
Description: GGMUG is the Gwinnett, Georgia, Microsoft User Group. We are a user group for developers and architects who work with Microsoft technologies like .Net, ASP.Net, SQL Server, Sharepoint, etc.

Name: Marietta WordPress Meetup
Description: We're a group of local WordPress users who get together to share our knowledge and experience, and to meet other WordPress users in the area. This WordPress Meetup is open to all who are eager to learn more about WordPress --- the software, the community, and the business!

Name: The Atlanta Game Developer Meetup Group
Description: A meetup for local game developers to network, share ideas, showcase projects, test out new lectures or anything else that catches our eye. Stay informed about local game development studios, schools, seminars and conferences.

Name: Atlanta Amazon Web Services Community
Description: A group organized by Amazon Web Services to foster a community around the AWS platform. Each month we will discuss AWS products, architectures and other topics that relate to building, migrating and optimizing cloud applications.

Name: Sensors and Startups
Description: This group is dedicated to design, engineering, and marketing of technology at the intersection of sensors, tiny computers, data, and the internet – the Internet of Things (IoT). We are talking hardware startups, urban infrastructure, wearables, health monitoring, environmental monitoring, office robots, drones, and more. Let’s cross pollinate experiences and opportunities among DIY’ers, engineers, designers, researchers, and entrepreneurs. Along the way we hit Arduino, Beaglebone, Raspberry Pi, Node.js, Bluetooth, WiFi, 3D Printing, DIY Robotics, Computer Vision, and Smartphones.

Name: Lean Software Atlanta
Description: This is a group for anyone who is interested in the principles, philosophies and methodologies of lean software development. Software Engineers, UX Designers, Product Managers, Data Scientists, QA & DevOps, Product Owners, Business Stakeholders and anyone else interested are invited to join the folks from Pivotal Labs Atlanta to share the day to day practices of what it means to place humans at the center of the lean software creation experience.

Name: Ladies That UX ATL
Description: Ladies that UX ATL is an informal get together of talented and intelligent women. This isn’t about networking or finding the next great job, although you may find one by speaking to some of the attendees. This isn’t about showcasing your product. This is about building relationships, both professional and personal, with other women in the UX community and finding the support and encouragement you need over snacks and drinks. Join the conversation on twitter! Follow @LadiesThatUXATL!

Name: The Atlanta Drupal User's Group
Description: The Atlanta Drupal Users Group (ADUG) is a community of designers, developers, site builders, and engineers who work with Drupal to create websites and web applications for educational, commercial, professional, and personal use. This group's primary goal is to help spread the collective knowledge of all things Drupal, as well as educate and train users on the newest technologies and features associated with Drupal to further the experienced Drupaler's understanding.

Name: PonceCityMarketStartupLunch
Description: Every Thursday meet other startups at Ponce City Market for lunch.

Name: Atlanta Microsoft
Description: Office hours can be booked at http://www.flatironcity.com/microsoftinnovationcenter .

Name: SplunkATL
Description: SplunkATL is a Splunk User Group designed to foster and educate our local community of Splunkers (definition - a person who likes to Splunk).

Name: Atlanta Society for Business Intelligence (ASBI)
Description: • The Atlanta Society for Business Intelligence (ASBI) promotes the education and fosters connections among organizations either currently employing or interested in leveraging business intelligence to impact organizational decision-making

Name: GAIT - Greater Atlanta Internet of Things
Description: This is a group of members who are interested in the Internet of Things in the Greater Atlanta area.

Name: Big Data (native Hadoop) Ingest & Transform, Atlanta Chapter
Description: Welcome! Big Data Ingesters,

Name: Greater Sum - Accelerate your software career
Description: Are you looking to start a career in software development? We want to share our collaborative, hands-on classroom with learners at all levels, especially beginners with little or no experience. If you've been learning on your own and want to start connecting with the larger community of software learners, this is a great place to start!

Name: Atlanta Data Visualization
Description: This is a group for people who genuinely enjoy learning, sharing, creating and designing anything data. It's about telling a story, and how data visualization is becoming more important than ever. So if you're creative, obsessed with data visualization, and love infographics, come join the rest of us!

Name: Design and Illustration Meetup
Description: Free meetup for software users of Adobe and popular art, design and development programs.

Name: Atlanta Salesforce Developer Group
Description: Welcome to the Atlanta Salesforce Platform Developer User Group!!!

Name: AtlantaLGBTtech
Description: AtlantaLGBTtech was created to put a face on the intersection of the Atlanta's tech startup scene and the vibrant LGBT community. The goal is to showcase the great people and organizations that are actively championing inclusivity in a field that is often perceived as being exclusive. Additionally, a strong focus is on Atlanta—not only its people but also its places.

Name: Applied Data Science of Atlanta
Description: Applied Data Science in Atlanta is a Meetup group to bring together data scientists from varying industry specialization and experience levels can learn from each other. The focus of this meetup is on building dynamic teams from the membership. The meeting is designated to pairing up projects or data challenges with interested participants. Members can submit problems they wish to solve from data they have. 1 to 3 can give a brief presentation during each meeting. There would be open discussion. Beginners will be able to get hands on experience working on projects. Experts can get exposure to data problems in different industries with access the data to work on them.

Name: Atlanta Developers - ADEV
Description: Total immersion in all things Opensource....Java, C++, and Web. Monthly meetings to network with fellow developers passionate about Opensource technology. Guest Speakers and Panels, Networking, Giveaways/Prizes...and in the true nature of Opensource, this Meetup is what YOU make it!

Name: Code + Design Atlanta
Description: HI ATL!!!!

Name: OWASP Atlanta
Description: Atlanta based group for the global Open Web Application Security Project focused on discussing, presenting, and addressing the worlds current web based threats affecting traditional and non-traditional web environments and related threats.

Name: General Assembly
Description: This group is for anyone interested in tech, business, or design. At General Assembly, we are creating a global community of individuals empowered to pursue work they love, by offering full-time immersive programs, long-form courses, and classes and workshops on the most relevant skills of the 21st century – from web development and user experience design, to business fundamentals, to data science, to product management and digital marketing.

Name: TRC Professional Solutions Classes
Description: This meetup is actually a class that will allow anyone the ability to learn HTML, CSS, MySQL, PHP, and programming methodologies. The class is run by our Recruiting Team Lead, Zach Sines, and has four different flavors: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, and Workshops.

Name: Atlanta Tech Meetup
Description: The Atlanta Tech Meetup supports the vibrant and growing Atlanta tech community. Our goal is to help build a sustainable technology industry that drives innovation, economic growth, and creates positive change for our local communities and the world. We bring the innovation community together - technologists, entrepreneurs, academia, investors, service providers, and thought leaders - to learn and share. Each monthly meeting features speakers, technology demos, new company presentations, a tremendous amount of high-value networking.

Name: Product Hunt – Atlanta
Description: Fan of Product Hunt? Are you an entrepreneur? A software developer? A graphic designer? Do you just like keeping abreast of all of the cool new products and services on the web?

Name: Atlanta Cloud Foundry Meetup
Description: This is a meetup for anyone interested in Cloud Foundry and its ecosystem.

Name: Atlanta OpenStack Meetup Group
Description: This is the Atlanta OpenStack developer Meetup. We are a group of free software developers who are passionate about working together to help make the Openstack project a success!

Name: Learn to Blog Meetup with DryerBuzz
Description: Learn to blog monthly meetup with Atlanta super blogger DryerBuzz of DryerBuzz.com and friends. Learn art of story telling, business blogging, video and use of tools to create buzz and become household name. Enjoy Saturday morning inside the blogosphere. Learn to broadcast business or personal branding message with tools of the trade and turn followers into customers.

Name: Society of Lady Makers Atlanta
Description: We're a social group for women who make things. From bloggers, to seamstresses, to designers, to developers, to welders and DIYers. We welcome any women who consider themselves makers, as well as the people who support them.

Name: Atlanta R Users Group
Description: R is an open source programming language for statistical computing, data analysis, and graphical visualization. While most commonly used within academia, in fields such as computational biology and applied statistics, it is rapidly gaining currency in commercial areas such as quantitative finance and business intelligence.

Name: Atlanta Mobile Marketing Organization (AMMO)
Description: The Atlanta Mobile Marketing Organization (AMMO) is a group devoted to exploring the emerging technologies and services that will be required of organizations looking to capitalize on this unique marketing tool. We will seek to educate marketers, technologists and business owners on best practices as they relate to mobile marketing initiatives. Our goal is to create a community based on sharing knowledge and experiences from multiple disciplines.

Name: Scaling Agile Atlanta
Description: This scaling agile start-up group was created to provide a place to get together so that we can all learn and collaborate about a variety of methods for implementing lean|agile methods in large enterprises--including but not limited to: Kanban, SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), DaD (Disciplined agile Delivery), Lean Start-up methodologies, as well as related Agile Methodologies and practices such as XP and FDD (Feature Driven Development).

Name: The North Atlanta iOS Developers Group
Description: The purpose of this group is to discuss all aspects of iPhone / iPad (iOS) development. All levels of developers are welcome, from developers just starting out to experienced developers (with several applications on Apple's AppStore).

Name: BDPA ATLANTA
Description: We are a minority Technology organization dedicated to developing career-minded professionals through networking and education to become leaders and innovators in the technology industry! WE ARE DEDICATED TO S.T.E.A.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, & Math). Join us in the STEAM 5000+ Initiative!

Name: Atlanta Apache Spark User Group
Description: This is a group for users, enthusiasts, and explorers of Apache Spark from beginners to experts and everyone in between. Apache Spark is an open source big data processing framework that's easy to use, lightning fast, and provides analytics capabilities for solving complex problems. The libraries included with this framework enable SQL, data frames, machine learning, graph database and streaming capabilities to be combined within the same application. Come join this group regardless of your technical level or location!

Name: Atlanta Spring User Group
Description: ASUG is the first user group created to support the growing Spring community in the Atlanta area.

Name: The Atlanta Scala Meetup Group
Description: The Atlanta Scala Meetup Group aims to be a place where Scala programmers and others interested in the Scala language can meet together to share tips, techniques, news, and discuss all things related to Scala.

Name: Atlanta Internet Marketing
Description: Alanta Internet Marketing - Group Description

Name: Unity 3D Atlanta User Group
Description: About the Group

Name: Go User Group Atlanta
Description: Go Users Group Atlanta is a meeting place for people interested in developing and promoting the local Go development community.

Name: Georgia Startup: Idea to IPO
Description: Entrepreneurship permeates the culture of Silicon Valley - the innovation capital of the world.

Name: Metro Atlanta Bloggers
Description: We are currently updating our purpose for this group and who should join. Please stay tuned.

Name: Agile Atlanta
Description: This group is for people that are interested in both "Doing Agile" and "Being Agile".

Name: Atlanta MongoDB User Group
Description: This group is a place for developers to learn more about MongoDB, an open source, document-oriented, nosql database. If you are facing challenges with MySQL or Postgres or Oracle and want to explore a more flexible, scalable alternative, please join us at one of our monthly sessions.

Name: Atlanta Microsoft Business Intelligence Users
Description: Meet other local Business Intelligence (BI) fans and experts to discuss the Microsoft BI Platform (mostly SQL Server (http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/sqlserver/default.aspx) and Power BI (https://powerbi.microsoft.com/), but also SharePoint (https://products.office.com/en-us/SharePoint/collaboration) and Office (https://products.office.com/en-us/home)). Unless otherwise announced, we usually meet on the last Monday of every month (unless there is a holiday conflict). Our attendance is often between 50 and 75 professionals.

Name: Atlanta Analytics Meetup
Description: This is a group for anyone interested in meeting others in the digital measurement space to share knowledge and experiences.

Name: AMDEV - Atlanta Microsoft Developers
Description: Are you looking for a Microsoft related networking group that meets monthly inside the perimeter? Veredus is sponsoring and hosting a monthly user group in Buckhead that focuses on Microsoft technologies. The group will meet on the 2nd Tuesday of each month.

Name: Tyrannosaurus Tech - Atlanta
Description: Calling all tech enthusiasts and dreamers! This group is for anyone interested in technology, innovation, startups, web development, mobile development, web design, and general networking opportunities surrounding these and other topics. Tyrannosaurus Tech (http://www.tyrannosaurustech.com/) is a boutique software development firm located in Atlanta, GA. We're a group of geeks and love what we do so, this group is simply a means for us to meet other interesting folks in the area and share insights on trends and topics that excite us. Come join us for a casual get together soon!

Name: Internet Marketers of Georgia = IMOG
Description: If you are in the Atlanta area, and want to learn from great internet marketing experts, this is place to get together with other internet marketers and people wanting to learn the in's and out's of the Internet Marketing. We'll discuss...

Name: Geekspace Gwinnett
Description: We are a makerspace in Gwinnett County, Georgia.

Name: eXcelerate SQL Basics
Description: This is a group for anyone interested in learning all things SQL from start to finish.

Name: Social Media Marketing For Business
Description: This group consists of Business Owners, Entrepreneurs, and Bloggers that want to take the mystery out of Social Media Marketing strategies that work for business! This Group is also connected with Social Media For Business Atlanta so there's no need to join both groups.

Name: Learn to Code Atlanta
Description: Have you ever thought about learning to code but weren't sure how to get started? Let's meet and explore the fundamentals of programming, including how to write code as well as how to develop an attitude that will enable us to quickly learn new technologies. Each meetup will be led by an expert who will guide us in a new skill or concept, and help us get started with programming, whether as a career or as a hobby. Here are some example workshops: • HTML / CSS Workshop: Let's build a website • Web Dev 101 Workshop • Intro to Javascript • Intro to Angular JS We will also host some intermediate to advanced workshops. All levels are welcome to attend :)

Name: CoderDojo McDonough
Description: Tentative dates for coding sessions:

Name: Atlanta Software Craftsmanship
Description: Atlanta Software Craftsmanship is a group of software professionals based in the Atlanta area. We are interested in advancing our craft and improving our own skills.

Name: Latinos in Tech Atlanta (LiT ATL)
Description: We're a group of individuals interested in developing, promoting, fostering, strengthening, and improving the Latino/a tech community in Atlanta. Come hang out, grab a beer, and meet other latinos who love tech and startups.

Name: Atlanta Quality Assurance Association (AQAA) Meetup
Description: If you are interested in Software Development and a focus on delivering Quality products - come join others with that same goal. Learn from others through interaction with others and dynamic speakers exchange of information about Quality Assurance, Software Testing, and latest trends in our industry. Get help from others if you are wanting to get into the industry or if you are looking for a job.

Name: Cloud, Big Data, and Data Science Group of Atlanta
Description: This is a group for anyone interested in Cloud, Big Data, Data Science, Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, OpenStack, Spark, Hadoop, Pig Latin, Hive, Docker, Machine Learning, Salt, etc. All skills levels are welcome. We started this group to share knowledge and to meet other Cloud, Big Data and Data Science enthusiasts. Looking forward to meeting you. We would like to thank Rackspace Inc. for graciously providing the meetup space.

Name: ADP® Atlanta Data Science Meetup
Description: The ADP® Data Science Lab is located in Tech Square. This meetup is for undergraduate and graduate students who are interested in a career in data science.

Name: Black Men Code
Description: Black Men Code is a non-profit organization with the mission to provide free and low-cost computer science education to underrepresented males. We seek to serve underrepresented males in grades 6-12, undergraduates and professionals. Please join if you are interested in either full-time Summer or after-school courses for your Middle School student, weekend programming courses for adults, tutoring referrals for Middle School, High School and Adult education, events to support access to jobs in software development and IT and networking for entrepreneurship.

Name: Podcast Atlanta
Description: The mission of Podcast Atlanta is to provide monthly venues for experienced, new or aspiring podcasters. We meet to discuss all the topics related to podcasting. Plus, it gives us all a chance to get to know and support one another while we learn and grow our shows. Everyone from hobby podcasters to full-time professionals are welcome to join Podcast Atlanta for free.

Name: Alpharetta -Agile User Group
Description: For the people who want to know more about Agile, want to learn how to do it better, want to find resources and chat about it!

Name: The Maker Station
Description: https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/8/7/7/a/600_385534682.jpeg

Name: Atlanta Internet Video Marketing Association Meeting
Description: The Atlanta Internet Video Marketing Association is designed to keep its members up to date on all the latest techniques for video search engine optimization and generally improve the marketing capability of video on the internet. It is especially useful for video production companies, internet developers and marketers. It's a great place for those representatives to network and collaborate.

Name: ALT.NET Atlanta Pragmatic Programmers
Description: Meet Atlantans interested to learn pragmatic ways for developing and delivering .NET based software. See http://ATLALT.NET/screwturn to learn more about this brand new group and our goals. Based on the ALT.NET approach, we are Passionate, Pragmatic, and Progressive. From http://altnetpedia.com : "We are a group of .NET developers who are passionate about improving the way we develop software. We recognize there is no single solution, but instead there are multitudes of alternatives that can be applied to different situations. Our community is a place for sharing these alternatives, so that together we can learn, teach, and encourage new ideas. - You're a developer who uses what works while keeping an eye out for a better way. - You reach outside the mainstream to adopt the best of any community: Open Source, Agile, Java, Ruby, etc. - You're not content with the status quo. Things can always be better expressed, more elegant and simple, more mutable, higher quality, etc. - You know tools are great, but they only take you so far. It's the principles and knowledge that really matter. The best tools are those that embed the knowledge and encourage the principles."

Name: Georgia Oracle Users Group Meetup (GaOUG)
Description: GaOUG now has a Meetup Group! If you are an Oracle professional, user, or enthusiast in Georgia, consider joining our Meetup Group. GaOUG is a professional Oracle User Group headquartered in Atlanta, Ga. The user group was established over 20 years ago with the purpose of bringing together Oracle Professionals for the purpose learning and networking.

Name: Rails Girls Atlanta
Description: A meetup for women* of all skill levels in the Atlanta area wanting to improve their software development knowledge using Ruby on Rails. Beginner and seasoned pro friendly.

Name: Atlanta Cyber Security for Control Systems
Description: This is a group for professionals involved in Cyber Security for Automated Processes and Control Systems including security for Operating Technology (OT), Industrial Control Systems (ICS), SCADA Systems, Transportation Systems, Building Control Systems (BCS), and even emerging Internet of Things (IoT) systems.

Name: Atlanta Mobile App Business Meetup
Description: This meetup is all about apps and business. Put those two together, you have this meetup. Still not sure? You will meet others who are working in the mobile app business. You will learn how businesses around the city are using mobile apps in their operations. You'll meet mobile developers, marketers and entrepreneurs who are excited about the future of mobile applications. Not yet in the mobile app business? Come anyway, get involved. We'll discuss: app marketing trends in mobile usage things that work things that don't monetization user acquisition how to build engaging user experiences on mobile (touch driven experiences) We'll highlight our members apps and help them find traction. We'll help non-technical people find apps that work in their business. We'll share interesting apps with one another. This is a business focused mobile app networking group. It will be a success if we can help Atlanta continue it's trend towards being a mobile hub of innovation and business success. It is NOT a developer meetup. Our topics will lean heavily towards marketing, business and user experience.

Name: Kubernetes Atlanta Meetup
Description: Meet other developers and users of Kubernetes. Kubernetes is an open source orchestration system for Docker containers. It handles scheduling onto nodes in a compute cluster and actively manages workloads to ensure that their state matches the users declared intentions. Kubernetes can run almost anywhere, including Google Compute Engine, Vagrant, CoreOS, Azure, vSphere, RackSpace, etc. Learn more about Kubernetes at http://kubernetes.io

Name: AlphaRetta Ventures & Incubator
Description: Alpharetta GA is home to many Fortune 100 and 500 companies. From the likes of AT&T, HP, ADP McKesson, Siemens, Verizon, and many more. The Alpharetta High-Tech corridor spans from Mansell Rd to Windward Pkwy and is lined with high speed fiber optics cables throughout the city. I do attend several Meetup's in Atlanta and find it difficult to attend these events after hours. I have this burning desire to not only participate in a startups, but to have Alpharetta eventually competing with Silicon Valley. I am sure there are many others who would gamble their free time to be part of something more exciting and possibly more rewarding. Our meeting will basically look at ideas, resources and funding to produce winners. I have more than enough ideas to get this started and will be happy to bring others on board to make this venture a success.

Name: Alpharetta Artists and Techies
Description: Though many see art and technology as somewhat at odds, the fact is that they have long existed and developed collaboratively. Leonardo da Vinci, Su Song, and Jung's Artist-Scientist archetype each demonstrate the power that can be obtained by combining the two disciplines. Alpharetta hosts over 600 technology companies and numerous art communities and guilds, yet there is infrequent crossover between the two. This group is intended to be an active bridge between both communities thru demonstrations, lectures, and activities. Each meeting will feature one speaker from the arts community, and a one speaker from the technology community. Please join us as we explore how to combine the tremendous talent available in this city and surrounding areas.

Name: Code Career Academy Meetups - Gwinnett
Description: Code Career Academy is the place for both learning how to start your career in software development as well as accelerating your existing career by staying current on the latest technologies and trends. We host frequent MeetUps for free on a wide variety of technical and career related topics.

Name: Big Bang Data Science & Analytics Solutions - Georgia
Description: Welcome to Big Bang Data Science Solutions Inc

Name: Projects for Developers, CS Majors, and UX Designers
Description: You've learned a lot. You have learned to develop and do some programming. Whether its for back end, front end, or anything else, you've gained a skill that involves a lifetime of learning.

Name: CodeNewbie Atlanta
Description: If you're learning to code and are looking for a friendly group in the Atlanta area to code with, join CodeNewbie Atlanta! Learning to code is much easier when you do it with others :)

Name: IoT-Fintech-Blockchain-SmartCity (MobileMonday Atlanta)
Description: MobileMonday is the worlds largest and fastest growing Mobile/Wireless & Advanced Technology Non-Profit.

Name: Atlanta Intelligent Devices
Description: Intelligent Devices are shaping different industries such as automotive, healthcare, agriculture, etc. Come join the fun and interact with innovative people just like you. Let's take the potential of Intelligent Devices beyond the imagination.

Name: Graph Database - Atlanta
Description: Developers interested in learning about and working with graph databases for social, spatial, hierarchical or other highly connected data sets. We host hands-on lab sessions, technology reviews, topical lectures, and plenty of social beer nights. Curious about graphs, want to pimp your non-RDBMS skills? Join us!

Name: Atlanta WordPress Engineers
Description: Is this meetup for you?

Name: Quality People ATL Professional Networking Meetup
Description: Quality People ATL (QPAtl) represents a gathering of current and aspiring Quality and Process Improvement practitioners, from all industries and diverse backgrounds

Name: Analytics.Club Atlanta
Description: Analytics.CLUB (http://analytics.club/) is world’s largest volunteer led data analytics community. We are all motivated and tasked to create a friendly, information sharing community for local talent pool. We also support our strong offline community with online tools to improve engagement and create deep networks so we all could learn from each other. Professionals (from Fortune 100 Chief Analytics Officers to Leading Business Analysts), join #AnalyticsCLUB to help build a strong and vibrant data analytics community. You are welcome too!

Name: Joomla! User Group Atlanta
Description: Meet others in your local area who want to build websites with Joomla!

Name: Startup ATL
Description: Atlanta is thriving with startups and innovative entrepreneurs. Come join the fun and meet like-minded innovators and shakers in local tech startups. Talking with fellow founders will leave you with a sense of direction. We also host Atlanta's favorite Pitch Battles. Where can you find us of each month?

Name: Technology Association of Georgia
Description: It's a new world for tech, and the Technology Association of Georgia (TAG) has emerged as a world-class membership organization and an engine for economic development for the state of Georgia. TAG's mission is to educate, promote, influence and unite Georgia's technology community to foster an innovative and connected marketplace that stimulates and enhances Georgia's tech-based economy.

Name: WordPress Gwinnett
Description: Tired of everyone saying how easy WordPress is when you still struggle with basic things?

Name: Internet of Things Atlanta
Description: A group for technology professionals and students interested in the irreversible trends (e.g. Mobility, Big/Fast Data and Cloud Computing), leading towards the Internet of Things. The idea is to facilitate discussions, knowledge sharing, networking and collaboration opportunities around the digital/analog technologies and the information ecosystems, that will help evolve the Internet of Things.

Name: Tech400 Meetup
Description: Tech400 is for technology-minded individuals who desire to stay informed regarding the ever-changing tech industry in Atlanta. Our focus is specifically North Fulton where over 900 technology companies are located along the GA400 corridor. Highlighted events will include IoT, Cyber Security, Innovation, and FinTech.

Name: Software Craftsmanship Atlanta
Description: A group of programmers that are passionate about our craft. We have a different format from your usual technology user group. Here is our format: 0-3 Lightning talks (capped at 5 minutes each) - Anybody can have 5 minutes to talk about whatever topic they feel will be of interest to the group. You will be buzzed off at 5 minutes. ~30 min - Reading Discussion (usually a chapter or two from a book) ~60 min - Coding Exercise (we've done guided katas, randori, open coding of a problem, experiences... really anything as long as everyone is coding)

Name: Alpharetta Rails Coders
Description: As with all Frameworks, everything works in the demo and tutorial. Now you need to get the framework to do what you want it to do. We can help you overcome any Rails problem, from newbie to experienced developer, we can help. Don't know what Rails is and just want to learn, no problem, we can help you get your feet wet.

Name: Atlanta MEAN (Mongo, Express, Angular, Node) Developers
Description: http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/6/7/d/0/600_451826576.jpeg

Name: Atlanta IBM Cloud & Watson Meetup
Description: IBM Cloud Platform as a Service (PaaS) developed by IBM. It supports several programming languages, provides access to Watson cognitive API, provisions numerous persistence services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud. Bluemix™ is based on Cloud Foundry open technology. This group serves to help new developers and system operators understand the IBM Cloud and exchange ideas on how to best implement these services. [Not Affiliated with IBM].

Name: Ionic Atlanta
Description: This is a meetup group for Ionic Mobile application development, specifically with the Ionic Framework ( http://ionicframework.com ). We will discuss and present on Ionic, Cordova, Phonegap, Hybrid Development, and more! More information to come soon!

Name: Atlanta Mixed Reality Meetup
Description: VR | AR | MR | 3D | 360º Photos | 360º Videos | Oculus Rift | Samsung Gear VR | HTC Vive | PlayStation VR | The Future Arrives Shortly | Got an event that you would like promoted by the Atlanta Mixed Reality Meetup? Please email: DanSmigrod@WeGetAroundNetwork.com | The Guide to 69 360º 1-Click Cameras (https://www.we-get-around.com/buy-360-3d-vr-photo-video-1-click-camera/) curated by We Get Around Atlanta

Name: Anidata
Description: Anidata is a non-profit corporation consisting of established and aspiring data scientists who have come together with the purpose of applying data science to make a difference in the community.

Name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Atlanta
Description: Welcome BigFoots!

Name: Content Strategy Atlanta
Description: This group is for anyone who cares about content — content strategists, writers, editors, content managers, communicators, information architects, product managers, user experience designers, marketers, publishers, and more.

Name: Drone Racing Club™ (DRC) Atlanta, GA
Description: It is all about racing your drone for fun! Do you love the idea of POD racing in real life without the risk (i.e. Star Wars Episode I)? Are looking for a hobby that is exhilarating and fun beyond words? Do you own a drone? Are you curious about drones or a seasoned multi-rotor enthusiast? Are you a hacker or maker? If you answered yes to any one of those questions then you are likely a good candidate for this group. I am looking for like minded individuals to get together routinely to talk drone tech, discuss, build and plan monthly drone races throughout the Greater Metro Atlanta Area. Lets organize, build and GET RACING!

Name: Future of Data: Atlanta
Description: This meetup is focused on the Future of Data and the open community data projects governed by the Apache Software Foundation. Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Data enthusiasts who are building modern data applications. Our meetups cover all data -- data-in-motion and data-at-rest. Meetups provide an opportunity to listen, share and work hands on with other technologists in the open source and open community Apache tools.

Name: 22TechPark
Description: 22TechPark offers events to help technology entrepreneurs in the Greater Atlanta Area through our incubator. The goal of 22TechPark Meetups are to give IT startups the chance to practice pitching their companies and through this provide an environment that is conducive to teamwork, sharing, flexibility and execution. From a single person pod to a growing team, every type of startup is welcome to join 22TechPark's community of driven IT entrepreneurs. Take the first step towards developing your startup and flourishing within our community of IT professionals and attend any one of our events!

Name: The Atlanta SEO Meetup Group
Description: Atlanta SEO is for WEBSITE STAKEHOLDERS, i.e. people responsible for SEO on their employers and/or their own named websites. More specifically, Atlanta SEO is for Marketing Professionals, Business Owners, and Technical Professionals who want to learn more both from presenters and peers about Search Engine Optimization (SEO) techniques for the websites they own or manage. The goal is to gather and share advice on better ways to work with search engines. Learn more about Atlanta SEO at http://www.meetup.com/atlantaseo/about/

Name: Atlanta Informatica User Group
Description: Welcome to the Atlanta Area Informatica User Group. The goal of this group is to get together to learn, share, and collaborate with others that are working with-- or want to work with--the Informatica products. The members of the group will help to decide on topics for future meetings, present their experiences, and learn from each other.

Name: Alpharetta AI (Artificial Intelligence) Meetup
Description: This is a group to discuss and share latest developments in Artificial Intelligence including machine learning, computer vision, cognitive systems, genetic algorithms, neural networks, social robotics, etc. We'll also show tangible things like code, tools, platforms, APIs, SDKs, and robots. Join us!

Name: Amazon Sellers of Atlanta
Description: This is a group for individuals interested in networking with others who sell on Amazon. Members of the group sell (or are intersted in selling) using various business models including:

Name: Atlanta Windows Apps
Description: We're a group of Developers, Designers, and Enthusiasts from the greater Atlanta area interested in building awesome Windows Store apps for Windows 8 and the Windows RT devices.

Name: Atlanta Salesforce Saturday Meetup
Description: Salesforce Saturday is where Salesforce.com Admins, Devs, BAs, and Users can come together over coffee/tea and share best practices and hone in on their skills.

Name: Atlanta CRM
Description: There are multiple options for Customer Relationship Management software in your organization. How do you learn about the various options?

Name: Big Data Hadoop Ingest Transform Apex Atlanta Online
Description: Welcome Big Data Ingesters/BigFoots!

Name: Atlanta Sitecore User Group
Description: Focusing on the industry-leading Sitecore CMS platform, the Atlanta Sitecore User Group is a networking group located in the Greater Atlanta area.

Name: MidTown - ATL - Database, Cloud, Virtualization & Storage
Description: Talk database, cloud, application, virtualization, big data, open-source and storage trends and new directions (Oracle, SQL Server, mySQL, SAP HANA, Azure, AWS, vCloud Air, Database-as-a-Service, Platform-as-a-Service, Infrastructure-as-a-Service, VMware, Hyper-V, Data Lakes, Cassandra, MongoDB, noSQL, CouchBase, Linux, Flash storage trends and new directions)

Name: Ethical Hackers, Penetration Testers, & Information Security
Description: Our group focuses on Network infiltration, Web application vulnerability testing, security assessments and of course CTFs.. Geeking out on all things InfoSec, play a little and Learn alot!

Name: GAIT - IoT Analytics Atlanta
Description: This is a group for anyone interested in Internet of Things (IoT) Analytics, more specifically building an IoT Analytics solution using Big Data tools. I started this group to meet with IoT enthusiasts and IoTA professionals with the goal to discuss IoT business problems from a strategic non-technical perspective as well as from Big Data technologies side of things to discuss how data is acquired and stored, how it's processed & transformed and how it can be used to deliver business insights.

Name: Big Data Atlanta Meetup
Description: Atlanta Big Data! So we have gigabytes, terabytes, petabytes of data, but what is it good for? Our group will focus on analytics and highlight methods to find value in your big data, including but likely not limited to batch and stream processing, database applications, machine learning, predictive analytics, reporting and integration with the broader business intelligence and IT ecosystem. We will have regular meetups to discuss platform technology, solutions, success stories. Topics will include Architecture and platforms, Commercial products and implementations, Open source projects and integrations, and Local industry spotlight and use cases.

Name: Learn to Code | Thinkful Alpharetta
Description: Thinkful Alpharetta helps you learn new skills and become hired developers and data scientists. We host workshops, info-sessions, tech talks, and happy hours focused on helping you learn how to code. So whether you are just beginning to learn the basics, don't even know where to start, or have dabbled in development or data science already, come join us!

Name: Atlanta SharePoint & Office 365 User Group
Description: This is the Atlanta SharePoint and Office 365 User Group. We were founded in April 2009 and have finally made the move to Meetup. We are a community organization for all SharePoint and Office 365 users, developers, administrators and related professionals. Come join us on the third Monday of the month.

Name: Southeastern Inventors Association
Description: The Southeastern Inventors Association (SIA) is an innovative network for inventors and resource providers. Based in greater Metro Atlanta area, the SIA brings together a diverse group of people. From those just beginning their inventing journey to those with patent in hand combined with people who provide resources, we offer a chance to meet and collaborate twice monthly. Our association meets on the 4th Saturday each month (except 2nd Saturdays for Nov & Dec).

Name: Atlanta Xamarin Users Group
Description: Calling all Xamarin developers in the Atlanta area! We have started this Meetup to create a group which fosters the sharing of ideas and learning on Xamarin. This spectacular platform is an ideal digital solution that enables developers to easily create cross-platform mobile apps using a device's native UI with C#, simplifying mobile application creation. We hold hands-on sessions, solve problems, and bring in various speakers to cover a range of mobile development topics. This growing platform is young and together we'll be able to share ideas and challenges to make all our lives a little easier. If you're a developer, designer, manager, QA or mobile user, this group is right for you!

Name: Southeast Information Technology Professionals
Description: This group is up for grabs, I am stepping down.

Name: Atlanta-Lean-Startup-Circle
Description: Fail often learn quickly... Lean startup uses customer development to reduce waste, reduce time to market, increase contact with customers and avoid incorrect market assumptions.

Name: RIoT Atlanta
Description: RIoT Atlanta is the Atlanta chapter of the RIoT organization. Collectively RIoT represents a network of technologists, engineers, business leaders, academics, policy makers, and entrepreneurs, all of whom have a stake in the Internet of Things industry. Companies ranging from startups to international heavyweights meet frequently to exchange ideas, to learn new technologies, and to create new opportunities. The Internet of Things is here, and it’s growing. Our mission is to create a community that captures IoT opportunities locally, nationally, and globally.

Name: Atlanta Artificial Intelligence Meetup
Description: Anyone interested in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Neural Network ...

Name: Counterpoint Hackerspace
Description: We are Counterpoint. Counterpoint is a hackerspace for technical-creative projects, doocratically run by our members. We are a non-profit educational institution intended for public benefit. Come and visit our space located in Roswell, Georgia. We teach, we learn, we share.

Name: Ember.js Atlanta Meetup
Description: Follow Us on Twitter at @AtlantaEmber (https://twitter.com/AtlantaEmber)

Name: OTP Developers
Description: We're a bunch of developers who love to learn and share new technologies and skills.

Name: Atlanta Cassandra Users Group
Description: This group is for Cassandra users and those new to Cassandra to discuss all aspects of its usage, from schema design to operations.

Name: Hyperledger Atlanta
Description: Hyperledger is an open source collaborative effort created to advance cross-industry blockchain technologies. It is a global collaboration, hosted by The Linux Foundation, including leaders in finance, banking, Internet of Things, supply chains, manufacturing and Technology.

Name: Nonprofit Tech Club Atlanta
Description: Social changemakers, non-profit workers, volunteers and technological forerunners come together at Nonprofit Tech Club Atlanta events to mix, swap stories and ideas, build new relationships and learn skills.

Name: Social Media Atlanta
Description: Planning to host a Social Media Atlanta Week during 2017. -- A Twitter hashtag will be established (@SMATL2017).

Name: The Atlanta MySQL Meetup Group
Description: Meet nearby MySQL Users for conversation and fun! Come to a local MySQL Meetup to talk about the world's most popular open source database, get great tips and share new ideas. All levels of experience welcome! Looking for work? Looking for talent? Check out the Atlanta MySQL Jobs Google Group at http://groups.google.com/group/atlanta-mysql-jobs

Name: Government Blockchain Association - ATL Chapter
Description: GBA-ATL will play a key role in informing and facilitating the development of blockchain for industry, commerce, education and government. This group is for people who work in some capacity for public organizations and are interested in how the Blockchain impacts government agencies, departments and other public organizations. We are made up of government employees, contractors and interested parties in using and promoting government understanding and use of the Blockchain.

Name: Apache Spark
Description: This is a meetup for users of Spark (www.spark-project.org) in Atlanta, Georgia. Apache Spark is a fast and general engine for large-scale data processing.

Name: Meteor Atlanta
Description: Meet other developers using Meteor. Share your knowledge, apps, and get feedback from others. Meteor is an open-source platform for building top-quality web apps in a fraction of the time, whether you're an expert developer or just getting started.

Name: Digital Analytics Association - Atlanta Chapter
Description: The Digital Analytics Association Atlanta Chapter is a passionate group of digital analytics professionals, dedicated to making analytics professionals more effective and valuable through professional development and community. We hope to see you at a DAA Atlanta Chapter event!

Name: Learning “Machine Learning” by Example
Description: Learning “Machine Learning” by Example

Name: Adobe InDesign User Group - Atlanta
Description: The InDesign User Group is a group to help users access a wide range of InDesign and InCopy resources and get information about industry trends and events. Attend an InDesign User Group meeting to learn more about Adobe InDesign, InCopy and other Creative Cloud tools, connect with peers, and stay up-to-date on design and publishing trends.
